text:
I am experimenting a bit with Zygote, and this is an error I am getting while checking for this convolving kernels differentiability-
```julia> jacobian((a,b)->imfilter(a,b),randn(50,50),Kernel.gaussian(1))```
This is the error message-
```ERROR: Compiling Tuple{typeof(imfilter!), Matrix{Float64}, Matrix{Float64}, Tuple{OffsetArrays.OffsetMatrix{Float64, Matrix{Float64}}, OffsetArrays.OffsetMatrix{Float64, Matrix{Float64}}}, Pad{0}, ImageFiltering.Algorithm.FIRTiled{2}}: try/catch is not supported.```
I don't understand what should I do now?

text: I saw an issue had been filed regarding the same thing, but has not been solved yet. Does it mean I may have to write a custom adjoint to differentiate `imfilter`?
